tool.name: GATK4 AUTO SortSam (Picard)
tool.description: - Sorts a SAM or BAM file
tool.command:
#include source=$set_sections# @CMD_BEGIN@ SortSam #if $optional.arguments_file --arguments_file $optional.arguments_file #end if
#if $common.COMPRESSION_LEVEL --COMPRESSION_LEVEL $common.COMPRESSION_LEVEL #end if
#if $common.CREATE_INDEX $common.CREATE_INDEX #end if
#if $common.CREATE_MD5_FILE $common.CREATE_MD5_FILE #end if
#if $common.GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS $common.GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS #end if
--INPUT $INPUT #if $common.MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM $common.MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM #end if
#if $OUTPUT --OUTPUT $OUTPUT #end if
#if $OUTPUT_qname --OUTPUT $OUTPUT_qname #end if
#if $common.QUIET $common.QUIET #end if
#include source=$picard_ref_opts# --SORT_ORDER $SORT_ORDER #if $common.USE_JDK_DEFLATER $common.USE_JDK_DEFLATER #end if
#if $common.USE_JDK_INFLATER $common.USE_JDK_INFLATER #end if
#if $common.VALIDATION_STRINGENCY --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY $common.VALIDATION_STRINGENCY #end if
#if $common.VERBOSITY --VERBOSITY $common.VERBOSITY #end if
--TMP_DIR /tmp

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Input
param.help: Input BAM or SAM file to sort.

param.name: arguments_file
param.label: Arguments_File
param.help: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line

param.name: COMPRESSION_LEVEL
param.label: Compression_Level
param.help: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).

param.name: CREATE_INDEX
param.label: Create_Index
param.help: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.

param.name: CREATE_MD5_FILE
param.label: Create_Md5_File
param.help: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.

param.name: GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS
param.label: Ga4Gh_Client_Secrets
param.help: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.

param.name: MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM
param.label: Max_Records_In_Ram
param.help: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.

param.name: QUIET
param.label: Quiet
param.help: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.

param.name: USE_JDK_DEFLATER
param.label: Use_Jdk_Deflater
param.help: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output

param.name: USE_JDK_INFLATER
param.label: Use_Jdk_Inflater
param.help: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input

param.name: VALIDATION_STRINGENCY
param.label: Validation_Stringency
param.help: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program. Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.

data.name: OUTPUT
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: OUTPUT bam
data.help: Sorted BAM or SAM output file.

data.name: OUTPUT_qname
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: OUTPUT bam
data.help: Sorted BAM or SAM output file.

tool.help:
Sorts a SAM or BAM file.
Summary ~~~~~~~
This tool sorts the input SAM or BAM file by coordinate, queryname (QNAME), or some other property of the SAM record. The SortOrder of a SAM/BAM file is found in the SAM file header tag labeled SO.
For a coordinate sorted SAM/BAM file, read alignments are sorted first by the reference sequence name (RNAME) field using the reference sequence dictionary tag labeled SQ. Alignments within these subgroups are secondarily sorted using the left-most mapping position of the read (POS). Subsequent to this sorting scheme, alignments are listed arbitrarily.
For queryname-sorted alignments, all alignments are grouped using the queryname field but the alignments are not necessarily sorted within these groups. Reads having the same queryname are derived from the same template.
Inputs ~~~~~~
- Input BAM or SAM file to sort - Sorted BAM or SAM output file - Sort order of output file
Usage example: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
::
java -jar picard.jar SortSam \ INPUT=input.bam \ OUTPUT=sorted.bam \ SORT_ORDER=coordinate
